alert.note: Alert for Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Richmond and southwestern Aiken Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Augusta Regional Airport, or 10 miles south of Augusta, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Augusta, Clearwater, Hephzibah, New Ellenton, Jackson, South Augusta, McBean, Gloverville, Augusta Regional Airport, Burnettown, New Savannah Bluff Lock & Dam Park, Savannah River Site Badge Office, Westover, Richmond County Recreation Center, Phinizy Swamp Nature Park, Kendan Park, May Park and Audubon`s Silver Bluff Sanctuary. This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 6 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
